history.content:
I would highly recommend at least one of CS162/164, depending on your interest. Honestly speaking you should take one and have at least a decent grasp of the other. I took CS164, but I had quite a bit of prior systems experience and studied the material with friends taking CS162.

CS170 is core to CS, so you shouldn't really consider dropping it. You would likely be served well by dropping CS 188 in favor of 162/164. If Math 110 is taught by a relatively liked faculty member next semester, I would also recommend taking it as it provides a much stronger foundation for linear algebra than just Math 54/ EE16A.

Additionally, unless you're going for some kind of graduate degree, I wouldn't consider 189 alone to be enough ML to do very many interesting things in industry without a solid linear algebra + probability background. However, CS 189 would allow you to understand news that you hear or new breakthroughs to a first order.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I took CS 189 and CS 162 (along with EE 16B) last semester (Prof. Recht/Malik and Prof. Joseph). It was kind of tough, but manageable because 189 and 162 are different types of classes. 189 is a class where theres a problem set due every 2 weeks, and 162 is a project class where you also have a group to rely on. For 162, there was either a homework, design doc, or project due every other week, and it was perfect because 189 psets were due in the weeks in between 162 assignments were due. Of course this basically meant I was constantly working.

189 had 1 midterm, 1 final last semester, and 162 had 3 midterms. These didn't really overlap, so it wasn't a huge issue.

I would highly recommend at least one of CS162/164, depending on your interest. Honestly speaking you should take one and have at least a decent grasp of the other. I took CS164, but I had quite a bit of prior systems experience and studied the material with friends taking CS162.

CS170 is core to CS, so you shouldn't really consider dropping it. You would likely be served well by dropping CS 188 in favor of 162/164. If Math 110 is taught by a relatively liked faculty member next semester, I would also recommend taking it as it provides a much stronger foundation for linear algebra than just Math 54/ EE16A.

Additionally, unless you're going for some kind of graduate degree, I wouldn't consider 189 alone to be enough ML to do very many interesting things in industry without a solid linear algebra + probability background. However, CS 189 would allow you to understand news that you hear or new breakthroughs to a first order.

children.subject: I highly recommend Stankova for 110. The class was well laid out and the material makes me much more confident in my EECS classes. The lectures were easy to digest despite being at 8am.
At least according to her website, Stankova is scheduled to teach 110 again in the fall, btw.

history.content:
I switched majors to CS pretty late and am taking most of my upper divs during my senior year. I really want to take both CS 162 and CS 189 (I'm told 162 is recommended for everyone and 189 for interest), but its advised not to take them together. Has anyone taken them together and have any thoughts? This would be my last semester, so I could get away with only taking these two classes. 

If it helps, I am planning on taking CS 170 and CS 188 in the Fall. Would it be better to swap out one of these two classes for 162/189.

Also, if I had to choose, I would take CS 189 over CS 162. Is CS 162 that important in the private sector?
history.subject: Taking CS 162/CS 189 Together
